result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua William Clark

records.addlTxt: 2:35PM Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Joshua William Clark.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

9:20 AM Defendant Joshua William Clark appeared by video.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video on behalf of Ryan O'Hara for Joshua William Clark.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sergeant Brandon Jones sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:56 PM Defendant Joshua William Clark appeared by video.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Joshua William Clark.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom. Time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
